snippet: Days after knife-wielding assailants killed 29 people and injured 143 at the train station in Kunming, Chinese authorities appeared eager to change the subject.
abstract: Upbeat coverage of annual gathering of Communist Party leaders dominates airwaves in China as authorities seek to shift attention from massacre at Kunming train station; government faces quandary as it seeks sympathy from international community while trying to avoid inflaming public enmity toward Uighurs, Muslim minority blamed for killings; reports on capture of suspects in massacre is relegated to brief dispatch by state-run news service.

byline.contributor: Patrick Zuo contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Days after knife-wielding assailants killed 29 people and injured 143 at the train station in Kunming, Chinese authorities appeared eager to change the subject.

headline.main: Chinese Officials Seek to Shift Attention From Rampage
headline.print_headline: Chinese Officials Seek to Shift Attention From Rampage
